description:
Bacteroides stercorirosoris is a species of anaerobic, Gram-negative, rod-shaped bacteria that are commonly found in the human gut microbiome. The name "stercorirosoris" translates from Latin as "of the reddish-brown feces," reflecting its habitat and potential association with certain digestive conditions.

Bacteroides stercorirosoris is a member of the Bacteroidetes phylum, a group of bacteria known for their ability to degrade complex polysaccharides and carbohydrates. This species is considered an important commensal organism, playing a role in the breakdown and utilization of dietary components within the human intestinal tract.

Research on Bacteroides stercorirosoris is ongoing, and its specific metabolic capabilities, interactions with other gut microbiota, and potential contributions to human health and disease are still being investigated. Understanding the ecology and functions of this and other Bacteroides species can provide insights into the complex dynamics of the human gut microbiome and its implications for various aspects of human physiology and health.
prompt: Provide a short scientific description of this species: Bacteroides stercorirosoris
